items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message: High river levels today, 15 January 2026, may lead to flooding. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Church Laneham to Rampton Road. There is the potential for moderate rainfall this afternoon/evening. River levels at Torksey Gauge will remain high until the 19/01/2026. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 17:00pm on 15/01/26 or as the situation changes.

Forecast rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 . 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Cotes, Loughborough, Zouch, Kegworth, Ratcliffe on Soar, Meadow Lane at Loughborough, the access road from Ratcliffe on Soar to Redhill Marina, the A6006 at Zouch, Soar Lane Sutton Bonnington, Moor Lane Normanton, Station Road at Kegworth, Kegworth Road, The Green Ratcliffe on Soar, Slash Lane at Sileby, the Mountsorrel to Sileby road, the B5328 Cossington Road, and the access road to Sileby Mill. Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. River levels at the Kegworth Gauge will begin rising at 13:00 on 15/01/2026. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Water levels are high on parts of the River Cherwell. Therefore flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, near Enslow, Thrupp and Kidlington. Widespread persistant rain is expected today (Thursday 15 January) which will be heavy in places. Further rainfall is possible tomorrow. We expect river levels to rise in response and to remain high over the weekend.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00 pm, midday, on the 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. River levels at Frisby on the Wreake Gauge will begin rising at 16:00 on 15/01/2026. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from approximately 16:00. 
Rainfall today will cause river levels to rise again and may result in flooding. Locations most likely to be affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, particularly in the Horley area. River levels are expected to remain high for the rest of today and overnight tonight. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further messages if required. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water and avoid riverside footpaths. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

We are closely monitoring the situation .

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message: River levels on the mid Bristol Avon and Semington Brook are stable. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Semington Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed. Further rain has started to fall and is forecast to continue through Thursday. River levels are likely to rise again in response to this rain and continue rising overnight into Friday. We are closely monitoring the situation and clearing debris from weed screens. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated on Friday morning, or sooner if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message: Heavy rain is expected throughout the day on Thursday 15 January, river levels are expected to rise leading to increased flooding of low lying land and roads close to the rivers, particularly on and around Water Lane and Lingfield. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 6:00pm on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Thursday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 from 15:00, as a lot of rain is forecast (25mm). 
If as much rain falls as predicted, flooding could affect Hammer Lane, Grove Hill, and Mill Lane Hellingly. From 21:00 15/01/2026 flooding could begin to approach properties on Station Road, Church Lane and Church Road, Hellingly. From 03:00 16/01/2026 flooding could affect North Street, River Lane, The Old Clergy House, Deans Place Hotel, Alfriston. River peaks similar to 09/01/2026. Rain should ease by 23:00 15/01/2026. Only isolated showers forecast Friday to Monday. River levels and flood risk should begin to reduce by 07:00 16/01/2026 in Hellingly, and 16:00 16/01/2026 in Alfriston. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . Avoid roads that flood (Mill Ln Church Rd Hellingly, North St Alfriston). 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Friday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 16 January 2026 as 15mm of rain is forecast. 
Minor flooding will continue to affect fields and gardens near Fittleworth. River levels at Fittleworth are expected to rise Thursday evening. Not significantly higher than Wednesday. Minor flooding affecting fields, gardens, and roads could affect Lodsbridge near Selham from 02:00 16/01/2026. River levels again not much higher than Wednesday. Between Liss and Midhurst only minimal flood impacts are expected. The river should peak by 22:00 15/01/2026 in Liss, 11:00 16/01/2026 near Lodsbridge and Saturday in Fittleworth. Only showers from Friday, so flood risk should reduce from Saturday. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have including in Lodsbridge and Fittleworth. Avoid roads that flood (Iping). 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 16 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message: High groundwater levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area. Groundwater levels are high in response to heavy rainfall earlier in December. Levels are slowly falling but remain high, and flooding of fields and roads is still possible. Groundwater levels are falling but further rainfall in the coming days may lead to levels rising once more. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. We are closely monitoring the situation. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 20th January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.message:

Flooding is possible from overnight on 15 January 2026 . 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including the Morrisons parks at Glenfield and Anstey. Low-lying land and farmlands in the Glenfield, Anstey, Sileby, Thurcaston, Rothley, Newtown Linford, Cropston, Swithland and Quorn areas. Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. River levels at Glenfield Gauge will begin rising at 14:00 on 15/01/26. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Trent, River Greet, Potwell Dyke, Carr Dyke, Dover Beck, Cocker Beck, Thurgarton Beck, Fairham Brook

items.message:
Rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the evening of 15 January 2026 . 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around the tributaries of the River Trent in Nottinghamshire, the River Greet, Potwell Dyke, Dover Beck, Cocker Beck, Woodborough Brook, Ouse Dyke, Thurgarton Beck and others. There is moderate rainfall forecast this afternoon/evening. River levels at Lowdham Grange Gauge will begin rising at 16:00 on 15/01/26. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Loughborough urban watercourses and local tributaries to the River Soar
items.message:
Forecast rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 15 January 2026 . 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Kingfisher Way, Forest Road and Monarch Way from the Wood Brook, the Grace Dieu Brook, Burleigh Brook, Black Brook, Grammar School Brook, Hermitage Brook, Sileby Brook, Long Whatton Brook, King’s Brook and Kingston Brook. Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. River levels at the Loughborough and Shepshed Gauges will begin rising at 12:00 on 15/01/2026. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

Forecast rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from overnight on 15 January 2026 . 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Sharnford, Croft, Littlethorpe, the Mill on the Soar car park, Falconry, Littlethorpe, Braunstone, Aylestone, Abbey Park, Birstall and Wanlip, and Braunstone Lane East. Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. River levels at the Sharnford and Littlethorpe Gauges will begin rising at 13:00 on 15/01/2026. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 14 January 2026 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and checking rainfall and river levels. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water Avoid low lying roads near river which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 15 January 2026 or as the situation changes.
